message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR 

The paper deals with a computer vision problem of color constancy, which involves learning to estimate the illumination of a scene from its appearance. This falls under the category of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a novel algorithm that involves training a series of cascaded convolutional neural networks, which is a popular technique in machine learning (cs.LG). The algorithm also involves ensembling multiple hypotheses and optimizing them in a coarse-to-fine manner, which involves techniques from artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper evaluates its algorithm on public benchmarks, which involves metrics and evaluation techniques from multimedia (cs.MM) and information retrieval (cs.IR).
